body_html:
@asimshankar

  • @jart

A little more detail may help:

The GraphDef protobuf (graph.proto) is the topmost object in our TB event file. When we create a TB event file and load it in TB, we see the GRAPHS tab selected, and our neural network rendered properly.

GraphDef contains a repeated list of NodeDef protobufs (node_def.proto). This was the basis for the proposal of adding gpu_details protobuf to NodeDef.

Your guidance is to not use NodeDef protobuf, and use NodeExecStats instead. I'm happy to take your advice. However, I do not see where the NodeExecStats protobuf (step_stats.proto) gets added to the graphdef protobuf.

Question: What is the relationship between NodeDef and NodeExecStats? In other words, how can I fill a gpu_details protobuf inside NodeExecStats object and relate it to each NodeDef in a GraphDef?

A little more detail may help:
The GraphDef protobuf (graph.proto) is the topmost object in our TB event file.  When we create a TB event file and load it in TB, we see the GRAPHS tab selected, and our neural network rendered properly.
GraphDef contains a repeated list of NodeDef protobufs (node_def.proto).  This was the basis for the proposal of adding gpu_details protobuf to NodeDef.
Your guidance is to not use NodeDef protobuf, and use NodeExecStats instead.  I'm happy to take your advice.  However, I do not see where the NodeExecStats protobuf (step_stats.proto) gets added to the graphdef protobuf.
Question: What is the relationship between NodeDef and NodeExecStats?  In other words, how can I fill a gpu_details protobuf inside NodeExecStats object and relate it to each NodeDef in a GraphDef?
body:
@asimshankar 
+ @jart 

A little more detail may help: 

The GraphDef protobuf (graph.proto) is the topmost object in our TB event file.  When we create a TB event file and load it in TB, we see the GRAPHS tab selected, and our neural network rendered properly.

GraphDef contains a repeated list of NodeDef protobufs (node_def.proto).  This was the basis for the proposal of adding gpu_details protobuf to NodeDef.

Your guidance is to not use NodeDef protobuf, and use NodeExecStats instead.  I'm happy to take your advice.  However, I do not see where the NodeExecStats protobuf (step_stats.proto) gets added to the graphdef protobuf.  

Question: What is the relationship between NodeDef and NodeExecStats?  In other words, how can I fill a gpu_details protobuf inside NodeExecStats object and relate it to each NodeDef in a GraphDef?
